channel.title: Aprs on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Aprs on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Ann Arbor area APRS network status, January 2016
item.description: APRS is the “Automatic Position Reporting Service”, a system for sharing information about the position of participating amateur radio stations. Clients transmit position reports on 144.39 Mhz; digipeaters repeat these reports to other monitoring stations; and various IGate sites monitor transmissions and send their findings to aprs.fi which collects worldwide data. In recent memory there has been an APRS digipeater in Chelsea, Michigan with wide area coverage, good enough to pick up travellers on I-94 west of Ann Arbor.
